content:
No, not everyone can apply for a diplomatic passport. Diplomatic passports are issued to individuals who are travelling abroad for official purposes on behalf of their government, such as diplomats, government officials, and other individuals representing their country abroad.

The requirements for obtaining a diplomatic passport vary by country, but generally, an individual must be a citizen of the issuing country and hold a valid official position in the government or other relevant organization. The individual must also pass a security clearance and background check, and may be required to provide additional documentation or meet other specific criteria, depending on the country's regulations.
